text: Dear team, I am working for a B2B lead generation company and currently are using sales hub pro for tracking our client on boarding process. Since we are also doing outreaching on behalf of those clients, we are trying to incorporate those campaign data that we run on behalf of our clients into HubSpot as well. So we are able to create and keep all our dashboards in one place for central access. Would love to hear how we might be able to go about it.
Hey <@U06QRMBUB70> Thanks for the response. Could you clarify? I am not a developer, but is there anywhere i could get more info on this please? Thanks!

Hey all : )
I am currently using HubSpot's meeting link for demo sign-ups, which is embedded on my website under my domain. Additionally, the tracking code is embedded on the site.
However, I've noticed an issue with the tracking of incoming leads. Despite our efforts, the original source of these leads is being recorded as direct traffic. In reality, these leads should be attributed to paid search (ads properties are not being populated as well...)
Has anyone ever faced that issue and can assist?

Hi all,
I want the url for the meeting details webpage in HubSpot. My meetings are associated with a contact and I want to create a link in my app which takes them to the meeting details webpage. I do have the meeting Id and the contact Id just not able to figure out the url for it. Any help would be appreciated.

<http://www.yoururl.com/yourpage.htm?property1=value|www.yoururl.com/yourpage.htm?property1=value>

ie
<http://www.yourwebsite.com/yourpage.htm?source_type=Yelp|www.yourwebsite.com/yourpage.htm?source_type=Yelp>

You can get your exact HubSpot property name in the properties details
your conversion tracking code would be the thing you'd pass to a property using the query string

We’re having issues with HubSpot events not being passed onto the Facebook Conversions API. We’ve set up multiple events for various lifecycle stages, and each ad network. But none of these events are being passed into the Meta Events Manager. And I also noticed that on HubSpot, it’s saying the last synced events for the Meta lifecycle stages are all in April, even though there have definitely been lifecycle stage events since (and the other platforms have been synced more recently). I have no idea and can’t figure out why this is happening; would anyone be able to give any advice on where to look at, or how to fix this?

Help!

I have a blog post template that has a header module on it that I want to make global. I see that I can make it global from the Design Manager.

I just want to make sure I understand what will happen if I do that.

I'm _*expecting*_ that it will just *replace* that module on every post with my global version, but this is on like 200+ posts so I just want to be super sure before I pull the trigger. :face_with_peeking_eye:

I want to avoid a scenario where I have update every blog post and place the global module instead. If that's the only way to do it that's fine but I'm hoping it'll be easier than that.

Hey <@U071YF9HQF3> - haven't seen "those" Templates in quite a while.
I've tested it with a super old Template I've found in one of my dev accounts.
What I've done:
• created two pages with the same Template
• changed some text in the page builder 
• changed the module that I've applied changes to, to a global module
• opened the module
• clicked the "edit global content" button in the module
• applied the changes inside the global module and published them
• went back to my template and published it( haven't done that after changing the module to global)
• changes were applied to both pages

So I'd say it will work but please double-test it -> clone the existing blog template(s) and the module you'd like to have global, create a new blog, apply the cloned template to the blog, create some lorem ipsum posts, make the cloned module global, test it - after successful testing: make the module in the original template global and apply the changes.

A few tips:
• in case you should not know: HubSpot has a revision function build in. It's located in "Actions". you can roll-back almost everything. 
• if you have cloned the module before making it global there's a chance that you could simply restore it. 
• You could leave the "non-global" module version for "testing purposes" in the template and just hide it with a wrapping HTML(see screenshot). BUT depending on your module complexity and the generated content I'd suggest to delete it from the template once you've successfully moved to the global version(can have SEO and performance impacts)
Hey folks - if you're going to post a big chunk of code, PLEASE do so in a thread so it doesn't make the scrolling experience more challenging :slightly_smiling_face:
